result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J French was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Samuel J French in court with attorney Katherine Jean Graber.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.   
Attorney Bayer makes recommendations to the court regarding sentencing.  Attorney Graber makes statements to the court regarding sentencing.  


The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence:
6 Months Jail straight time CONSECUTIVE to present sentence.  (0 days credit) 

Term of Probation: 1 Year-  Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County.  
Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Maintain/Obtain full time employment; or school   
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

Court orders forfeiture of weapon from incident and return of property being held to defendant.
Case not called on the record due to ongoing jury trial in Br. 4. Jury trial is off, case set for plea/sentencing hearing on 05/17/16 at 930am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.
